title: Calories in Salt Water Taffy
meta_description: Discover calories in salt water taffy per piece, including carbs, sugars, sodium, and nutrition breakdowns for this classic candy treat.
assumptions: Standard piece (~7 g), vanilla or fruit-flavored, pulled saltwater taffy without nuts or coatings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, piece size, and ingredients; check packaging for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One piece of salt water taffy contains about 25 calories, primarily from carbohydrates and sugars.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: With added nuts (peanut taffy) per piece

faqs.q: How many calories in one piece of salt water taffy?
faqs.a: Approximately 25 calories per standard 7 g piece.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in salt water taffy?
faqs.a: About 6 g carbs per piece, mostly sugars with no fiber.

faqs.q: Does salt water taffy have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Negligible fat (0 g) and protein (0 g) per piece; it's mostly sugar-based.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in salt water taffy?
faqs.a: Around 15 mg sodium per piece due to the saltwater component.

faqs.q: Calories in a handful of salt water taffy?
faqs.a: A typical handful (5-6 pieces) is about 125-150 calories; portion control is key for candy.
